admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Flood protection,General transportation sector,General public administration sector
sectr: Water, sanitation and flood protection,Transportation,Public Administration, Law, and Justice

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Cyclone Emergency
            Recovery Project are to assist the government of Samoa to
            recover from the damage caused by Cyclone Heta and reduce
            the vulnerability of its people to prevailing natural
            hazards through: (a) Recovery of coastal resilience to
            erosion, flooding, and landslide hazards through appropriate
            and sustainable use of structural and non-structural
            protection; (b) Nurturing the recovery of fragile coastal
            ecosystems through sustainable practices; and (c)
            Rehabilitation of damaged land transport communications. The
            main benefits are increased resilience to natural hazards of
            social infrastructure in the coastal areas at highest risk.
            Also access to emergency relief will be more reliable in the
            event of a future disaster. Arrangements for procurement,
            financial management, and implementation address the
            fiduciary risks of the project.
